title: Gargoyles
body:
Etymology

Common Name: Gargoyles

Domathundic: Kákoil

Émanic: Gágoiles

Old Humanic:

Astánan:

Ussurian:


The Twelve Gargoyles

  • Iedon
  • Ágúg
  • Eðok


Five of the Gargoyles rejected the rule of the Baðkilla, and as punishment they were branded with a pair of horns upon their upper back to highlight that, unlike the Hagathisk and the Baðkilla, they lacked horns, and were therefore the weakest of the Tripartite.
preface: The Gágois (Gargoyles) were created by Urúneen to fight against the other Spirits.
